metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0477 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The parse function in Email::Address module before 1.905 for Perl uses an inefficient regular expression, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via an empty quoted string in an RFC 2822 address.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0477` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libemail-address-perl - 1.905-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> fixes in both 1.904 and 1.905 (and maybe before?)

criterions.comment: libemail-address-perl package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.905-2').
